cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as automatic post-editing. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of an NMT architecture, which is a common technique in the field of machine translation, a subfield of NLP. 

The paper also mentions the use of a transformer model, which is a type of neural network architecture commonly used in NLP tasks. This makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. 

The paper also explores joint training of the APE task with a de-noising encoder, which involves training a neural network to remove noise from input data. This is a common technique in the field of machine learning, which falls under the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also mentions the adaptation of the NMT architecture for exploiting context information, which involves the use of recurrent neural networks (RNNs) or attention mechanisms. This makes cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another likely sub-category. 

Finally, the paper does not mention any specific sub-category, but it deals with natural language processing tasks, which can fall under the sub-category cs.CY (Computers and Society).
